concept-wr.title: Interfaces Tab
concept-wr.shortdesc: The Interfaces tab on the Inventory Detail page presents details about the logical L2 network interfaces on a node.

conbody.p: The following example is for an unlocked controller node:

US66653 info about creating a profile removed to another topic; US82332 updated interface namesIn this example, the node has three allocated interfaces. The interfaces enp0s3, connecting to the OAM network, and enp0s8 connecting to the internal management network, reflect the allocation given when the node was provisioned.
On a configured compute node, the Interfaces tab presents additional logical interfaces. The following example is for a locked node:

CGTS-2934 updated text to match screen shotIn this example, the node has four allocated interfaces: enp0s3 connecting to the infrastructure network, mgmt0 connecting to the internal management network, and eth0 and eth1 connecting to the provider networks providernet-a and providernet-b, respectively. The interface mgmt0 is auto-provisioned as part of the automated software installation process on the compute node. It can be modified but not deleted.

note.p: US71812 added NUMA mesh info:For data interfaces, you can optimize vSwitch processing of packets to and from physical ports by using only ports that are connected to processors with vSwitch cores. For more information, see Titanium Server Cloud Administration: .

conbody.p: Information about interfaces is presented in several columns, as follows:

dd.p: The name given to the logical L2 interface.
The type of network the logical network interface is connected to. The options are:

li.p: data, for a compute node data interface
infra, for the optional infrastructure network
mgmt, for the internal management network
pci-passthrough, for a PCI passthrough interface

dd.p: The VLAN ID of the network listed in the Network Type column, if the network uses a shared interface. For more information about shared interfaces, see Titanium Server Planning: .
The physical ports on top of which the logical interface is built. Multiple ports are displayed when the logical interface uses LAG.
The interface used by the network listed in the Network Type column, if the network uses a shared interface. The VLAN ID of the network is shown in the Vlan ID field.
The networks that share the interface using VLAN tagging, if the interface is shared. For more information about shared interfaces, see Titanium Server Planning: .
This option is relevant for compute nodes only, and for interfaces of the data network type. It lists the provider networks associated with the data interface.
Details including the current MTU size for the interface and whether the interface is DPDK-accelerated.

On a locked node, you can modify a logical interface, and execute management operations on it. This is implemented using the Edit Interface and More buttons. These buttons are not available when the node is unlocked.
